p: Furthermore, the carbons of the N-propyl group in compounds ( 5a, e, g, k, and 9a) appeared as three signals resonating at δ (11.60–11.65 ppm), (20.81–20.87 ppm), and (41.28–41.48 ppm) for –CH 2 CH 3, N-CH 2 CH 2, and N-CH 2, respectively, and the carbons of the N-isobutyl group in compounds ( 5f, l and 9b) appeared as three signals at a range of δ (20.36–20.45 ppm), (27.22–23.88 ppm) and (47.10–56.51 ppm) due to –CH( CH 3) 2–, – CH(CH 3) 2– and – N-CH 2–, respectively. Finally, a signal attributable to the benzylic (–CH 2–) carbon in the N-benzyl derivatives ( 5d and 5 m) appeared around δ 43.10 ppm.
